properties.name: triple_surge
properties.description: Three surges occur almost at the same time. At least one seems triggered by the other

properties.name: penckbreen_surge
properties.description: Penckbreen advances while still clearly showing the basal topography. It almost looks transparent.

properties.name: sysselmanbreen_slow_flow
properties.description: Sysselmanbreen is moving by about 25 m/yr in a strange direction.

properties.name: scheelebreen_slow_surges
properties.description: Four slow surges, and a fast one, at/near Scheelebreen

properties.name: tinkarpbreen_slow_surge
properties.description: Tinkarpbreen has been advancing substantially for the last 10 years#

properties.name: franklinbreen_lake_interaction
properties.description: Søre Franklinbreen has a supraglacial/marginal lake that drains partially mid-series. Incidentally, it also seems to slow down then

properties.name: triple_surge
properties.description: Three surges occur almost at the same time. At least one seems triggered by the other

properties.name: penckbreen_surge
properties.description: Penckbreen advances while still clearly showing the basal topography. It almost looks transparent.

properties.name: sysselmanbreen_slow_flow
properties.description: Sysselmanbreen is moving by about 25 m/yr in a strange direction.

properties.name: scheelebreen_slow_surges
properties.description: Four slow surges, and a fast one, at/near Scheelebreen

properties.name: tinkarpbreen_slow_surge
properties.description: Tinkarpbreen has been advancing substantially for the last 10 years#

properties.name: franklinbreen_lake_interaction
properties.description: Søre Franklinbreen has a supraglacial/marginal lake that drains partially mid-series. Incidentally, it also seems to slow down then

properties.name: aasgardfonna_advance
properties.description: Longstaffbreen and parts of Åsgardfonna are advancing

properties.name: ringhornbreen_ice_flow
properties.description: Ringhornbreen and Royal Societybreen showing agood example of how ice flow looks like.

properties.name: bjorlykkebreen_surge
properties.description: Bjørlykkebreen surges concomitantly to Lilliehöökbreen retreating out of its way. Perhaps it is connected.

properties.name: fjortende_julibreen_instability_wave
properties.description: A wave of destabilization can clearly be seen before/during the surge of Fjortende Julibreen

properties.name: stone_deltabreen_double_surge
properties.description: As soon as the Stonebreen surge reached the top, Deltabreen started surging.

properties.name: rutenbergbreen_melt_advance
properties.description: Rutenbergbreen shows strongly negative mass balance. Despite this, it is advancing.

properties.name: alfarvegen_bu_surge
properties.description: Bottom-up surge of Alfarvegen

properties.name: hole
properties.description: A hole disappears.

properties.name: braasvellbreen_recession_and_advance
properties.description: Bråsvellbreen retreats and advances in the same frame

properties.name: austfonna_double_advance
properties.description: Flòtbreen and Winsnesbreen are both advancing in the frame for two distinct reasons.

properties.name: dunerbreen_advance
properties.description: Dunérbreen is advancing in what might be the slowest surge ever.

properties.name: hayesbreen_subglacial_lake
properties.description: Hayesbreen has a massive subglacial lake that is slowly either filling up again, or is replaced by ice.

properties.name: hayesbreen_surge_bulge
properties.description: Hayesbreen is probably far away from surging (no low-coh signal), but it clearly builds up for a surge.

properties.name: slakbreen_mass_redistribution
properties.description: Slakbreen is flowing faster than before and is almost offsetting its retreat

properties.name: vegbreen_bulges
properties.description: Vegbreen and its nearby cirque has two surge bulges

properties.name: lisbetbreen_dead_ice_melt
properties.description: Lisbetbreen and Universitetbreen nicely showcase dead-ice melt

properties.name: wahlenbergbreen_surge
properties.description: The full surge of Wahlenbergbreen is caught

properties.name: hornbreen_surge_like_drainage
properties.description: The top of Hornbreen (Bendfjellbreen) drains as if Hornbreen has a surge. Saying surge is not out of the question.
